alert.note: Alert for Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT MACON AND SOUTH CENTRAL SWAIN COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Franklin, or 5 miles northeast of Nantahala Lake, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Highlands, Nantahala Lake, Sky Valley, Wesser, Ellijay, Burningtown, Kyle, Otto, and Wayah Bald. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
